pages.text: Runes arranged in the world can create marvelous effects. However, it would be nice to replicate (and improve upon) the primitive wooden charms our ancestors used. Metal runes are too heavy (and too poky) to wear around our necks, but they have proven durable enough to inlay into tools and armor.
Simply place an item upon a suitably advanced anvil (one such is depicted here), place a rune on top, and hammer the two until they merge.

A note on hammers: My assistant assures me that it's possible to $(l)USE$() a hammer to $(l)SHIFT$() your focus, and perceive the energy of rune arrays as they coalesce in the world. With this technique, he has demonstrated a remarkable ability to visualize the area in which these arrays will have an effect, an ability I can only mimic with the careful application of sight runes.
